Text:
This one's legit, FYI, unlike most of the other recent SH torrents.

On a musical note, though I loved the music during the movie, I don't feel like it stands alone as a soundtrack too well.  Zimmer (whom I usually LOVE) only created one main Sherlock theme and uses it over and over in virtually every track, which gets tiring.  Still nice to listen to, but 90% of the tracks sound exactly the same.  Also, it's missing some of the nice fiddle music in the movie--I presume those were actual songs and thus not able to be included on the soundtrack, the fiddletune playing during the credits was really why I wanted this album.

The traditional fiddle tune at the end of the movie during the credits is an Irish slip jig called ROCKY ROAD TO DUBLIN.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocky_Road_to_Dublin
Oh, ta, guilty1.  I might have recognized it if I'd listened to the words, but I was out of there before I'd have liked (perils of attending with antsy preteens).  *pulls out fiddle*

As I understand, the version of Rocky Road to Dublin was recorded for the movie, so it is most likely different from others. Total bummer, because that is why I was looking at this torrent.

-John

According to the credits the tune you are all looking for; "The Rocky Road to Dublin" is performed by The Dubliners. It's a remarstered version of the song found on their 1964 album simply titled "The Dubliners". So that's where to find it..
Also Dropkick Murphys has made a great version of this song...
